New Records: Ross Adair wins the Player of the Match award for his outstanding knock of a century off 58 balls
Ross Adair wins the Player of the Series award
Key Match Events: Ireland's bowlers turned the tide in the final overs to defend the total and level the series
Ross Adair scored a century off 58 balls
South Africa's chase of 196 was always going to be a formidable task, but they began with confidence, thanks to Reeza Hendricks and Ryan Rickelton
Pre-Game Insights: The Irish side will be under pressure to step up after their loss in the previous game
South Africa has looked a much better side after the poor show in the UAE against Afghanistan earlier
Aiden Markram will hope that the Proteas can once again step up their performances as they aim to secure their second win and confirm a clean-sweep series victory
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling, the winning captain, says that at the halfway mark, the team felt they were 15-20 runs short
Aiden Markram, the captain of South Africa, says that there were small moments with both bat and ball, which they missed on
Ross Adair says that he wanted to put his mark and get a good score
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather conditions in Abu Dhabi were expected to be warm and fiery, with the temperature hovering at 30 degrees Celsius
The match ended in a draw, with Ireland leveling the series 1-1
The first ball of the 3-match ODI series will be at 11.30 am GMT on October 2, 2024
